page.title: 01Burrington Parish SW
page.content: This area is the SW corner of Burrington Parish plus small portions of Ashreigney and Chulmleigh Parishes. It is bisected by River Taw, salmon fishing, the railway line and the A377 road which run from Exeter to Barnstaple. Burrington Parish boundaries are the Taw and the Mullybrook. The land is very rural. Almost no public transport. Dairy and sheep farming with corn crops grown from animal feeding. Although there are mainly farmhouses, there are some large gentlemens residences. Hansford House, Handsford Barton, Colleton Manor and Leigh House. The buildings are almost without exception old. The Planning regulations ake it impossible to build outside the centre of the village. My own house, Pennyhop (named I beleive since it cost one penny to travel by Stage Coach to Chulmleigh )
